title: Bucky Larson: Born to Be a Star
summary: Bucky is a small town grocery bagger, going nowhere in life – until he discovers that his conservative parents were once adult film stars!  Armed with the belief that he has found his destiny, Bucky packs up and heads out to LA, hoping to follow in his parents’ footsteps.(Columbia Pictures)
critic_reviews: That Bucky Larson's humor is stuck at a toilet-centric grade school level is less damning than how little of that or any humor it contains - the film, directed by Tom Brady (The Hot Chick), sets up scene after scene that wanders around in the general vicinity of a joke idea without ever approaching anything like a punchline.
Never thought we'd say this about a movie, but Bucky Larson probably doesn't wring as much out of recurring bodily-fluid gags as it could.
It's an ugly movie to look at and a faintly nauseating one to sit through, truth be told.
Bucky Larson is a one-note joke played over and over and over.
This movie is dire, soul-crushing stuff.
Of course, Bucky Larson isn't one of the year's worst films because its laughs are poisoned and problematic - rather, it's one of the year's worst films because there aren't any laughs at all.
The scenario makes for an inept, lazy R-rated movie whose sole purpose is as a glossary of euphemisms for genitalia and sexual acts.
Apparently no one told Ricci she was acting in a comedy, not a touching drama about a young woman overcoming a formative trauma to achieve her dreams.
One of the most astonishingly unfunny films of this or any other year.
This god-awful, unfunny, stinkingly putrid sketch-comic movie has exactly one snicker-worthy moment, involving Kevin Nealon and a stolen grape. But watching the rest of it will make you whine.
This may be the worst movie Pauly Shore has ever been in. Think about that.

Unfortunately, the R rating will prohibit the target audience -- namely teenage boys who find penis jokes endlessly hilarious - from seeing this relentlessly unfunny and vulgar effort until it shows up on video and cable.
What does startle is how tiresome it all is.

reviews.content: Absolute, utter garbage.  Nick Swardson is so void of talent that he should be banned from breathing.  Everything about this film is completely embarrassing to the film industry as a whole.  Seeing an actress like Christina Ricci in this filmAbsolute, utter garbage.  Nick Swardson is so void of talent that he should be banned from breathing.  Everything about this film is completely embarrassing to the film industry as a whole.  Seeing an actress like Christina Ricci in this film is just a disgrace and proof that her career is in the toilet.  There is nothing worthwhile to say about this movie, if someone were to like this then they probably have no soul and/or no brain.  Burn any copies you find and stop being friends with anyone who likes this kind of swill.  Very strong candidate for worst film of the year.
Skip-it - Christina Ricci and Stephen Dorff's careers are officially over. They are no longer stars. And neither is Bucky Larson. One of the worst films of the year.

Who ever keeps thinking crap like this (film?) should be made are devoid of all talent.A lot of the stars in this movie are ...ok actors, but this movie has done a great disservice to them all.Skip it or burn it your choice.

Yeah, this is a ZERO. Bawahahahahhaaa!  And since the review must be 150 characters long, there is room for some more bawahhahahahhhhahahahhhahaaaa. Some film exec probably got burned greenlighting this piece of work.

You would pretty much have to be an idiot not to expect this movie to be completely balls to the wall stupid. I'm not about to tell you that this is a good movie. It isn't. It's awful as far as movies go, but if stupidly offensive material isYou would pretty much have to be an idiot not to expect this movie to be completely balls to the wall stupid. I'm not about to tell you that this is a good movie. It isn't. It's awful as far as movies go, but if stupidly offensive material is what makes you laugh in a morbid so wrong its funny kind of way, then this is the kind of movie you could sit through once and enjoy. As a side note, I think it's kind of weird that the dude they have in the trailers (-five of him on screen at once- "RATED Awrrrr!") is in only one scene in the entire movie. Something tells me this movie was originally going to be longer cause there are a lot of plot holes. One of the big ones, if I'm not mistaken and just wasn't paying attention, is that suddenly right after being told that Bucky's porn movies would never be successful, they somehow go into production anyway. Like it literally jumps from the scene where all the potential investors decline being any part of it as they laugh their way out of the room right to the movies being an instant success. Whatever, I put way more thought into this than was ever necessary. It's a dumb movie, but if you like stupid comedies rent it. It's not really worth going to a theater to see.

This could very well be the death of rated R comedies. To say Bucky Larson: Born To Be a Star is an atrocious mess with horrible performances would be an accurate description of this movie. Where Bucky Larson fails is everywhere. It doesThis could very well be the death of rated R comedies. To say Bucky Larson: Born To Be a Star is an atrocious mess with horrible performances would be an accurate description of this movie. Where Bucky Larson fails is everywhere. It does nothing right. It is an abomination to the art of cinema. There is nothing redeeming about seeing this. Adam Sandler, whom I have a stronger hate for, should be ashamed. We got through Zoo Keeper and Just Go With It, but THIS is where it ends. What is there to say? Bottom line, if you want to see a "Rated R Comedy", watch Zack and Miri Make a Porno. That movies is leagues better than this.

I'm a movie critic for a Central Michigan University sponsored blog so I had to see the movie in order to review it, and could not be happier that I did. This is by far one of Adam Sandler's best productions, a nominee for movie of the year,I'm a movie critic for a Central Michigan University sponsored blog so I had to see the movie in order to review it, and could not be happier that I did. This is by far one of Adam Sandler's best productions, a nominee for movie of the year, and Stephen Dorff is a shoe in for best supporting actor. I don't think there was a moment when I wasn't laughing, and the movie also inspired me to pursue my dream of being a screen writer / comedian / adult film star. If you didn't like the movie I urge you to give it a second shot. Bucky for President 2012!!
This is better then most of the comedies out there. If a person doesn't get the humor then they probably shouldn't be writing a review. i would happily suggest watching this movie.

Don Johnson was certainly the highlight of this flick.  He truly sold the greasiness of his character, and his eyes bored through each line with drill-like charisma, at least until the rushed-climax/resolution.  Dorff somewhat dialed it in,Don Johnson was certainly the highlight of this flick.  He truly sold the greasiness of his character, and his eyes bored through each line with drill-like charisma, at least until the rushed-climax/resolution.  Dorff somewhat dialed it in, but was passable as the antago-douche.  Ricci didn't have too much to work with, the way it was scripted, but she definitely played it cute enough to get by.  Nealon was an unexpected hoot.  Mosseri was pretty funny for a background.  Sandler's standard roster of players could definitely have used waaaaaay much more screen time.  The casting of the hotties was done well, and there were a few shots that were cinematographically attractive, to my surprise.  Swardson immersed himself in a role which had to have been tough to sell, so he did what he could.  Raunchily bad overall?  Yes.  On-purpose?  Totally.  Take this movie for what it is.  I mean, look at the premise... what do you expect, Godfather?  A few giggles here and there, some writing holes, but eh.  The music selections and score were pretty good though, surprisingly enough.  I'll watch it again next time I'm sh!t-faced drunk with my friends and want to have some stupid guilt-free laughs.  I mean, what did you think you were going in here to see, the Godfather for chrissakes?   PS:  The talking mannequin in the porn shop was the breakout role of this film, everyone in the theater was shocked and laughing.

Bucky Larson: Born to be a Star. [raspberry] AS IF! Bucky Larson was never born to be a star, and only embarrasses himself inside this terrible, worthless, stupid comedy. It's most likely this will get a Razzie.

They're white, and see-through when reflected with light. Plus, the actors were just awkward at times. Every joke make me face-palm. You may get a few chuckles out of this movie, as in the grape scene. Possibly. Otherwise, this movie is pure garbage.

This movie is insulting to my intelligence. This movie is insulting to everyone's intelligence. The whole theme of the movie seemed vulgar, gross, and stupid, but I decided to watch it because Happy Madison has made some funny movies beforeThis movie is insulting to my intelligence. This movie is insulting to everyone's intelligence. The whole theme of the movie seemed vulgar, gross, and stupid, but I decided to watch it because Happy Madison has made some funny movies before with stupid premises and it was co-written by Adam Sandler so there was a good chance that this movie could have been funny. Unfortunately I couldn't have been more wrong. The movie tries to use two kind of humor, gross humor and stupid humor. In the end it manages to be stupid and gross but fails to be humorous in any way shape or form. It's a huge, unfunny, and insulting waste of time so don't watch it. I wouldn't wish this kind of torture on anyone. So save yourself and your brain cells and avoid this movie at any and all costs.
